content.text: The units of all physical quantities can be expressed in terms of SI base units
Which pair contains quantities with the same base units?
A force and momentum
B pressure and Young modulus
C power and kinetic energy
D mass and weight
Two physical quantities \(P\) and \(Q\) are added. The sum of \(P\) and \(Q\) is \(R\), as shown
Which quantity could be represented by \(P\) and by \(Q?\)
A kinetic energy
B power
C speed
D velocity
Space for working
A 1.5V cell supplies 0.20A to a lamp for seven hours before the lamp goes out
What is a sensible estimate for the initial chemical energy content of the cell?
A \(1\times 10^{2}\mathrm{J}\) B \(1\times 10^{4}\mathrm{J}\) C \(1\times 10^{6}\mathrm{J}\) D \(1\times 10^{8}\mathrm{J}\)
Three of these quantities have the same unit
Which quantity has a different unit?
A energy distance
B force
C power Ã— time
D rate of change of momentum
A cathode-ray oscilloscope displays a square wave, as shown in the diagram
The time-base setting is 0.20 ms per division
What is the frequency of the square wave?
A 8.3Hz B 830Hz C 1300Hz D 1700Hz
Space for working
adjusting the needle on a voltmeter so that it reads zero when there is no potential difference across it
What will reduce the systematic errors when taking a measurement?

In an experiment to determine the acceleration of free fall \(g\) , the time \(t\) taken for a ball to fall through distance \(s\) was measured. The uncertainty in the measurement of \(s\) is estimated to be \(2\%\) . The uncertainty in the measurement of \(t\) is estimated to be \(3\%\)
The value of \(g\) is determined using the equation
What is the uncertainty in the calculated value of \(g?\)
A bicycle brakes so that it undergoes uniform deceleration from a speed of \(8 \text{m s}^{-1}\) to \(6 \text{m s}^{-1}\) over a distance of \(7 \text{m}\)
If the deceleration of the bicycle remains constant, what further distance will it travel before coming to rest?
A mass on the end of a spring bounces up and down as shown, after being released at time \(t = 0\)
Which graph shows how the velocity varies with time?
Space for working
The diagram shows two spherical masses approaching each other head-on at an equal speed \(u\). One is of mass \(m\) and the other of mass \(2m\)
Which diagram, showing the situation after the collision, is not consistent with the principle of conservation of momentum?
the spheres stick together
Space for working
A molecule of mass \(m\) travelling at speed \(v\) hits a wall in a direction perpendicular to the wall. The collision is elastic
What are the changes in the kinetic energy and in the momentum of the molecule caused by the collision?
The IKAROS satellite has mass \(320 \text{kg}\) and moves through space using a solar sail of area \(20 \text{m}^2\). The average solar wind pressure is \(1.0 \times 10^{-5} \text{N} \text{m}^{-2}\)
What is the acceleration of the satellite caused by the solar wind?
Space for working
The graph shows the momentum of a cyclist over a period of 8.0s
At time 4.0s, she applies the brakes
What is the resultant force on the cyclist during the period when the brakes are applied?
Space for working

A hailstone, initially stationary at the base of a cloud, falls vertically towards the Earth. The diagram shows the magnitudes and directions of the forces acting on the hailstone as it starts to drop
Which diagram shows the magnitudes and directions of these forces when the hailstone attains a terminal (constant) speed in the air (of uniform density)?
Space for working
Four beams of the same length each have three forces acting on them
Which beam has both zero resultant force and zero resultant torque acting?
Space for working
The diagrams show the forces acting on different bodies
Which body **cannot** be in equilibrium?
A car travelling with speed \(28 \text{m s}^{-1}\) leaves a motorway on an exit road. The end of the exit road is \(22 \text{m}\) higher than the motorway
If only the force of gravity is considered, what will be the speed of the car at the end of the exit road?
Space for working
A piston in a gas supply pump has an area of \(400 \text{ cm}^2\) and it moves a distance of \(25 \text{ cm}\) during one stroke
The pump moves the gas against a fixed pressure of \(3000 \text{ Pa}\)
How much work is done by the piston during one stroke?
A transformer has the following input and output
What is the efficiency of the transformer?
It gains both gravitational potential energy and kinetic energy
The diagram shows a hydroelectric power station
The reservoir is linked to the turbines by a pipe of uniform cross-sectional area. Water flows from the reservoir, through the pipe and through the turbines at a constant rate
Which statement about the change of energy of the water as it moves from X to Y is correct?
Which row correctly describes the ordering and motion of the molecules in water and in ice when both are at a temperature of \(0^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\)?

table.html:
orderingmotion
Aa regular pattern of molecules in ice but not in watermolecules in both ice and water have the same average speed
Ba regular pattern of molecules in ice but not in watermolecules in ice travel more slowly than those in water
Ca regular pattern of molecules in both ice and watermolecules in ice travel more slowly than those in water
Da regular pattern of molecules in both ice and watermolecules in both ice and water have the same average speed

content.text: The diagram shows a rectangular block of mass \(8.2kg\) immersed in sea water of density \(1.10\times 10^{3}kgm^{-3}.\)
What is the difference in pressure between the top and bottom surfaces of the block?
Space for working
A trolley is held at rest between two steel springs
Each spring has an unstretched length of 0.10 m
Spring P has spring constant \(60 \text{N} \text{m}^{-1}\)
Spring Q has spring constant \(120 \text{N} \text{m}^{-1}\)
Spring P has an extension of 0.40 m
What is the extension of spring Q?
A lift is supported by two steel cables, each of length \(10 \text{m}\) and diameter \(0.5 \text{cm}\)
The lift drops \(1 \text{mm}\) when a man of mass \(80 \text{kg}\) steps into the lift
What is the best estimate of the value of the Young modulus of the steel?
Space for working
The diagram shows an air-filled pipe open at both ends. The length of the pipe is \(1.00 \text{m}\) and the lower surface of the inside of the pipe is covered with a layer of fine sand

When a source of sound of a single frequency is put near one end of the pipe, the air in the pipe is found to resonate and a pattern in the sand shows that a standing wave containing three nodes is formed within the pipe
The speed of sound in air is \(330 \text{m s}^{-1}\)
What is the frequency of the sound?
A \(330 \text{Hz}\) B \(495 \text{Hz}\) C \(990 \text{Hz}\) D \(1320 \text{Hz}\)
The fundamental frequency of the stationary wave decreases when some water is added to the cylinder
A stationary sound wave is formed in a measuring cylinder by blowing across the top, as shown
Which statement is correct?
microwaves passing a steel post
Diffraction can be observed when a wave passes an obstruction. The diffraction effect is greatest when the wavelength and the obstruction are similar in size
For waves travelling through air, what is the combination of wave and obstruction that could best demonstrate diffraction?

A health inspector is measuring the intensity of a sound. Near a loudspeaker, his meter records an intensity \(I\). This corresponds to an amplitude \(A\) of the sound wave. At another position, the meter gives an intensity reading of \(2I\)
What is the corresponding amplitude of the sound wave?
Space for working
The diagram shows two parallel plates

The plates are charged so that there is an electric field between them. P, Q and R are points which are \(\frac{1}{4}\) , \(\frac{1}{2}\) and \(\frac{3}{4}\) of the distance from the top plate to the bottom plate
What is the electric field strength at point P?
A the same as that at point Q
B twice that at point R
C half that at point R
D one third that at point Q
A positive charge of \(2.6 \times 10^{-8} \text{C}\) is in an electric field of constant field strength \(300000 \text{V} \text{m}^{-1}\)
How much work must be done on the charge in order to move it a distance of 4.0 mm in the opposite direction to the direction of the field?
A \(3.1\times 10^{- 5}\mathrm{J}\)
B \(2.0\times 10^{- 3}\mathrm{J}\)
C \(3.1\times 10^{- 2}\mathrm{J}\)
D \(2.0\mathrm{J}\)
Space for working
Which values of current and resistance will produce a rate of energy transfer of \(16 \text{Js}^{-1}\)?
A copper wire is stretched so that its diameter is reduced from \(1.0 \text{mm}\) to a uniform \(0.5 \text{mm}\)
The resistance of the unstretched copper wire is \(0.2\Omega\)
What will be the resistance of the stretched wire?
A \(0.4\Omega\) B \(0.8\Omega\) C \(1.6\Omega\) D \(3.2\Omega\)
Four statements about potential difference or electromotive force are listed
1 It involves changing electrical energy into other forms
2 It involves changing other energy forms into electrical energy
3 It is the energy per unit charge to move charge right round a circuit
4 It is the work done per unit charge by the charge moving from one point to another
Which statements apply to potential difference and which apply to electromotive force?

table.html:
potential differenceelectromotive force
A1 and 32 and 4
B1 and 42 and 3
C2 and 31 and 4
D2 and 41 and 3

content.text: Space for working
The diagram shows a four-terminal box connected to a battery and two ammeters
The currents in the two meters are identical
Which circuit, within the box, will give this result?
Space for working

In the circuit below, P is a potentiometer of total resistance \(10\Omega\) and Q is a fixed resistor of resistance \(10\Omega\) . The battery has an e.m.f. of \(4.0\mathrm{V}\) and negligible internal resistance. The voltmeter has a very high resistance
The slider on the potentiometer is moved from X to Y and a graph of voltmeter reading \(V\) is plotted against slider position
Which graph is obtained?
Space for working
Yes, it correctly combines two series resistors with one parallel resistor, and correctly uses Ohm's Law
The diagram shows a resistor network. The potential difference across the network is \(V.\)
Is the equation shown below correct for the network?

A nuclear isotope emits radiation which is detected by a Geiger-MÃ¼ller tube held at a distance of about \(10 \text{cm}\) from the radioactive source. The radiation is stopped completely by a \(2 \text{mm}\) thick sheet of lead
What can be deduced from this information about the emission from the isotope?
A It could be alpha and beta radiation, but not gamma radiation
B It could be alpha and gamma radiation, but not beta radiation
C It could be beta and gamma radiation, but not alpha radiation
D It could be alpha, beta and gamma radiation
What remains constant during \(\beta\)-emission from a number of identical nuclei in a substance?
A energy of the \(\beta\)-particles
B neutron number of the nuclei
C nucleon number of the nuclei
D proton number of the nuclei
Space for working
one \(\alpha\) -particle followed by one \(\beta\) -particle
The graph of neutron number against proton number represents a sequence of radioactive decays
Nucleus X is at the start of the sequence and, after the decays have occurred, nucleus Y is formed
What is emitted during the sequence of decays?
